showerReviews.reviewText: Greenpoint is such a lovely place to stay when you are on a lean budget like in my case. The interior is super cool, clean and well-maintained. The personnel i met upon my arrival are very warm, welcoming and customer-friendly too. ‚Ä¶

Great location within 5 minutes walk to subway and surrounded with plenty of restaurants to choose from. Nice green park located stone throw away from hostel is a plus. Room I stayed in was clean and tidy, although some funny chemical smell ‚Ä¶

If you dont want to spend so much money in NY choose this place. We had deluxe room with 2 queen size beds and large wardrobe. Bathroom is shared and not always perfectly clean but it depens with who you stay there at the moment. Simple ‚Ä¶

It was a late booking chosen for reasons of location and price. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. The room was clean and warm. Unfortunately we were next to the Men's bathroom and there were frequent visitors during the night ‚Ä¶

I booked this place for my husband and son in September 2018. They stayed three nights there. We thought it would be a lively joyous place, simple, but clean, modest but fine. It turned out to be the worst experience they ever had in a ‚Ä¶

Me and my friend slept well on the beds and they were kind of comfortable to lay on. The shared bathroom was the worst part of the stay. It was uncomfortable and the bathrooms made all the hallways smell of urine. The men's bathroom should ‚Ä¶

When you go to this website, it looks like a pretty, simple, bright, clean "hotel-esque" place to stay at a great rate in a notoriously pricey area. That alone should have set me straight. The lobby is your typical YMCA, with kids coming ‚Ä¶

I stayed here for 3 days and for $70 US a night for my own room it was perfect. It is nothing fancy and you have to walk to the bathroom from your room but I had a comfortable bed, TV, air conditioning and the location was great. ||Close to ‚Ä¶

showerReviews.reviewText: ‚Ä¶ some did not have hooks to hang dry clothing.  Floor wet due to shower rose facing partly towards door and inevitable water sprayed outside shower while trying to get temperature correct. At times no toilet paper or basin taps broken. No ‚Ä¶

Really enjoyed my stay. Interior is aging but clean, room with refrigerator, TV, AC and access to semi-private lavatories with shower (lockable) and a gym, it's great value for money. Man handling the bagage room looked tired and didn't ‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶ to be bolted to the wall cause you hear squeekin everytime someone moves. Room was extremely hot. Doors need to be painted a cheerful color they are all scrapped and brown color. The hallways are sad looking.  Shower low pressure Luke warm.

‚Ä¶ Firstly, showers were tiny, handles/shower heads broken, only cold water never hot, black mould everywhere in the showers which is an actual health hazard, no room to hang clothing or items whilst showering. ‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶ heater per room. Beds were comfortable even after a long day of walking. Bathrooms were three showers, four sinks, three toilet toilets. Well used, but everyone was cheerful and shared the space with no shower hoggers. Plenty of hot water. ‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶ Diner for breakfast, they were wonderful). Bring these things to help make your stay a bit more comfortable: good ear plugs, your own towel, an over-the-door shower hook, and an eye mask. I brought a camping pillow and a travel ‚Ä¶

For the price, this place can‚Äôt be beat. It‚Äôs close to everything and with the metro station nearby, it‚Äôs the best place to book during your short stay in New York. The bathrooms, while shared, are all individual with a sink and shower.

‚Ä¶ . Bunk beds were a little wobbly but they held my 235 lb butt very well. I didn't have to wait for a shower, but it can get congested depending on when you want to wake up. The hot water will eventually run out if you wait too long.  All ‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶ with the leisure center we had to wait in line for half an hour for towels as the staff were sorting memberships out for two people. Which is long when you have just arrived from a long haul flight and want a shower and to explore New York. ‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶ . Old A/C but doing its work. I had a single room with shared bath (3 showers for all man on one floor - tip: larger shower-rooms on gym 3rd floor) and got a side view if central park for something like 60 bucks. So I say go if you are on a ‚Ä¶

showerReviews.reviewText: This review is about YMCA summer CAMP at the Vanderbilt location. Our experience was -very- ba, with broken promises of field trips, camp counselors who did little more than day care, and limited facilities. ‚Ä¶

I stayed 4 nights. Great dorm like accommodations. The rooms are small but sufficient. Has A/C, fridge, HD cable TV, comfortable bed.  The shower/restroom was ALWAYS clean.  Washer & dryers very convenient and appreciated. Front desk ‚Ä¶

The overall experience was pretty well. The room was clean and they were changing the towels every day. We went in November and the weather was very cold but in our room we had a heater which was working well. Sometimes it was even too hot ‚Ä¶

The pool is overly crowded. They really should require members to make appointments to go in so it‚Äôs not crowded all the time. I ran into a male maintenance person when I walked out of the shower in women locker room. That was a terrible experience and they did not make any announcements ahead.

showerReviews.reviewText: Nice and shady park with great elevated views of the George Washington Bridge and Hudson River

J Hood Wright's park is a wonderful neighbourhood park in Washington heights area. Medium size park, landscaped with green lawn, small rocks etc. good pathway for jogging, plenty of trees, big play area for young children and big play area ‚Ä¶

It‚Äôs a cute little park with a front-seat view of the George Washington Bridge. Nice little dog run, playground with sprinklers, good-looking little gardens (that use composting), basketball court, tables inlaid with chess and checker ‚Ä¶

This is a lovely, lively neighborhood park. There are always birthdays, celebrations, dance classes, and sports games happening. There is a dog run, bathrooms, sports court, playground, splash pad, outdoor gym, and view overlooking the bridge. I love how many amenities are inside this small but important park.

This Washington Heights neighborhood park is well maintained and allows for a pleasant spot to walk your dog, take your family, and relax. It can get crowded during the summer and has different areas for different activities. Like Central ‚Ä¶

Large spaces degsined for different activities to match the visitors choices and provide a space for everyone to enjoy their time .The view of the bridge is one of the best for tourists .There are many swings,slides,and facilities for kids ‚Ä¶

The spring flowering trees are gorgeous. The play area for kids was wonderful for kids of all ages.  Not for teens. There are clean restrooms and plenty of places to sit.  There is a dog park. It's pretty big.
